instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.SMC_PM_G2_EN: What is SMC_PM_G2_EN? SMC_PM_G2_EN is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a prerequsite for all of the enable signals for the S5 rails to come on, such as P3V3S5_EN. S5 rails will not come on if SMC_PM_G2_EN is not coming..
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.SMC_ADAPTER_EN: What is SMC_ADAPTER_EN? SMC_ADAPTER_EN enables the machine to work off of the power adapter when the proper power adapter is attached. Attacching an 85w Macbook Pro 15” power adapter to a 13” Macbook that requires a 60w power adapter is ok, attaching a 45w Macbook Air power adapter to a 15” macbook Pro that needs an 85w power adapter will result in SMC_ADAPTER_EN missing. .
definitions.PM_RSMRST_L: What is PM_RSMRST_L? The "PM_RSMRST_L" signal, also known as "Resume Reset," is an active-low signal that is part of the power management system in MacBooks. It asserts a reset signal when it is low voltage which is what the _L is for. Is the machine is in a reset stage it will not properly power on..
definitions.SMC_BATLOW_L: What is SMC_BATLOW_L? SMC_BATLOW_L refers to a power management signal that indicates a low battery condition. The "_L" suffix suggests that this is an active-low signal, meaning that it becomes low when the battery reaches a low voltage threshold..
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_CPU: What is PPVCORE_S0_CPU? This is the primary power rail for the CPU that powers the CPU, known as CPU vcore. Without this, the machine will be braindead. .
definitions.R7402: What is R7402? Resistor between PPVIN_S0_CPUIMVP and CPUIMVP_TON. TON stands for TIME ON – CPUIMVP_TON configures the buck converter for the CPU based on its input power supply. If this resistor is blown, the machine will turn on but not have any image, chime, or POST, because CPU vcore will be missing. This resistor is often the first to corrode because it is along a high voltage rail and it is right on the edge of the board, check this on 2011-2012 model Macbook Pros that turn on and do not chime. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no poder, rotação gira e pára.
threads.message:
It suffered a lot of oxidation, there was a short on the <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> line, it was removed, but it still didn't turn on, I heated the PHC and SMC decided, it worked, I released it to the client, but the machine came back, with the defect of turning the cooler and stopping, the tensions are missing <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S3</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S3</SIGNAL>; <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 12.60v <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.49v <SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL>: 3.45V
<SIGNAL>SMC_ADAPTER_EN</SIGNAL>: 3.29V; <SIGNAL>SMC_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL>: 3.32V; <SIGNAL>PM_RSMRST_L</SIGNAL>: 3.27V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no poder, rotação gira e pára.
threads.message:
Mmmmh, if worked after reflowed the SMC, you should reball it now.
This is always recommended for liquid affected boards; especially when the spill was close to SMC.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no poder, rotação gira e pára.
threads.message:
I heated the PHC and the SMC with the intention of removing the garbage from under the pads, I heated it to 200 degrees .  Mas o SMC afeta a linha <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL>, s3 e s5?

Eu tive que fazer dois jumpers na linha <SIGNAL>ISNS_HS_OTHER_N</SIGNAL> e <SIGNAL>ISNS_HS_OTHER_P</SIGNAL>, porque o short fez um buraco quebrando as duas faixas

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no poder, rotação gira e pára.
threads.message:
Corrosion can damage solders underneath SMC; not sufficient to reflow it.

Do you mean <RESISTOR>R5410</RESISTOR> was corroded and you've bypassed it?
Noy a good idea, SMC will cannot correctly monitor CPU current consumption.

Please use english for main forum...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no poder, rotação gira e pára.
threads.message: Sorry for the language change, I replaced the <RESISTOR>R5410</RESISTOR> and pulled the tracks back to the <CHIP>U5410</CHIP> pads.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no poder, rotação gira e pára.
threads.message:
After the reballing, it seems that the voltages have normalized, it's taking 5v and 3v, but spin doesn't spin, you know how to be a friend?

voltage; <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 12.60V; <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> 5.10V; <SIGNAL>PP3V_S0</SIGNAL> 3.32v; <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> 3.31V; <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> 0V;

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no poder, rotação gira e pára.
threads.message:
Board cannot work if no CPU VCORE present.
If you get voltage on other coils (RAM, PCH), then check <RESISTOR>R7402</RESISTOR>/03 for corrosion.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no poder, rotação gira e pára.
threads.message: as tensões nos resistores <RESISTOR>R7402</RESISTOR> e <RESISTOR>R7403</RESISTOR> estão corretas. Agora as tensões <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> e <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> estão ausentes novamente. Você teria outra região que possa medir para identificar qual componente está causando esse defeito?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no poder, rotação gira e pára.
threads.message: Use english please, I do not understand you correctly...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no poder, rotação gira e pára.
threads.message:
[QUOTE="iClub, post: 59418, member: 24223"]
as tensões nos resistores <RESISTOR>R7402</RESISTOR> e <RESISTOR>R7403</RESISTOR> estão corretas. Agora as tensões <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> e <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> estão ausentes novamente. Você teria outra região que possa medir para identificar qual componente está causando esse defeito?
[/QUOTE]

Voce esta escrevendo em portugues. Em grande parte, digo 99% das pessoas aqui escrevem em ingles. Se quiser ajuda, so me chamar.
